I've got to be honest with myself here. I believe it's not just about getting paid or doing something good for someone else's sake. It's about showing respect and fairness. We're all in this together as members of our community, and we should treat each other with kindness and integrity.

As a police officer, I've seen firsthand the impact that people can have on one another's lives. And now, I'm faced with the decision of whether to help someone who doesn't even know me. My desire is to do what's right, not just to get paid or gain favor with anyone. I want to make a positive difference in this person's life.

Intentionally putting myself in a position where I can benefit from my actions isn't who I am as a person. I'm not looking for rewards or recognition; I'm doing this because it's the right thing to do. But, if I've got the chance to make someone else's day a little bit brighter without any expectation of anything in return, that's the kind of leader and member of my community I want to be.
